intro: Cephaloschoenus, commonly known as the flat sedge, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. These plants typically grow in wet or marshy environments, often in temperate regions. Cephaloschoenus species are known for their ability to thrive in poorly drained soils. They play an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and supporting various wildlife species.
